column4: My sound stopped working. I tried rebooting, restarting pulseaudio, reinstalled pulseaudio, but none of that helped. Alsamixer reports nothing as muted, lscpi logs are here: http://paste.ubuntu.com/1258478/
Does anyone know what to do?
it was working before?
Yes. The problem came out of nowhere
I'd just try an older version, see if it is the current version that's causing problems.
I mean it could still be a buggy version, just try the older.
or just try rm -r ~/.pulse ~/.pulse-cookie if you don't want to do that yet.
any luck?
After removing .pulse and .pulse-cookie, it doesn't even start anymore
do speaker-test in terminal too
once you've reinstalled pulse try pulseaudio --check if you haven't already.
can you hear anything during the speaker-test?
type padsp
Nothing happens
I don't know, at this point I'm just going to try and figure this out with you.
you could look at http://ptspts.blogspot.com/2010/11/how-to-disable-pulseaudio-on-ubuntu.html
maybe killing it will help. Won't hurt.
Sorry, it froze my computer and I had to reboot. Following the article you gave me worked, I have sound again.
so did it work?
More or less. Looks like I will have to write my own program to get bindings with the media keys thought. Thanks a lot!
no problem, you can probably go into the config file though and change those bindings unless you've tried that.
Config file of what? Pulseaudio is disabled now, and ALSA doesn't offer media key bindings, I think?
